org.obrel.type

Class AutomaticType<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • org.obrel.core.RelationType<T>
        • org.obrel.type.AutomaticType<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventHandler<RelationEvent<?>>, EventListener, ElementAccess<RelationType<T>>, ElementAccessFunction<RelationType<T>,Relatable,T>, java.io.Serializable, java.util.function.Function<Relatable,T>, Relatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CollectorType, CounterType

    public abstract class AutomaticType<T>
extends RelationType<T>
implements EventHandler<RelationEvent<?>>
    A base class for relation types that update their target or other state automatically based on other relations of the parent object it is set on. This is achieved by registering the type instance as an event lister for relation events on the parent of the relation with this type.

    If an automatic type is used as a view or and alias it will not have an automatic functionality but will work like a normal relation type.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • handleEvent

        public final void handleEvent(RelationEvent<?> rEvent)
        Implemented to invoke processEvent(RelationEvent) if the relation event is not for this type.
        Specified by:
        handleEvent in interface EventHandler<RelationEvent<?>>
        Parameters:
        rEvent - The event that occurred
        See Also:
        EventHandler.handleEvent(de.esoco.lib.event.Event)

      • processEvent

        protected abstract void processEvent(RelationEvent<?> rEvent)
        Processes a relation event to perform the automatic function of this type. Will only be invoked if the relation event is not for this type. The source of the event will be the relatable object on which the relation has been modified, not the one on which this automatic type relation has been set (an object, relation, or relation type). The latter is available from RelationEvent.getEventScope().
        Parameters:
        rEvent - The event to process

      • addRelation

        protected Relation<T> addRelation(Relatable rParent,
                                  Relation<T> rRelation)
        Overridden to add this instance as the relation listener if it implements the EventHandler interface. Also checks the modifiers of this type and invokes protectTarget(Relatable, Relation) it is either RelationTypeModifier.FINAL or RelationTypeModifier.READONLY.
        Overrides:
        addRelation in class RelationType<T>
        Parameters:
        rParent - The parent object of the new relation
        rRelation - The relation to be added to the parent
        Returns:
        The relation to add
        See Also:
        RelationType.addRelation(Relatable, Relation)

      • getListenerType

        protected RelationType<EventDispatcher<RelationEvent<?>>> getListenerType(Relatable rParent)
        Returns the event listener relation type for a certain parent object.
        Parameters:
        rParent - The parent relatable
        Returns:
        The corresponding event listener relation type

      • protectTarget

        protected void protectTarget(Relatable rParent,
                             Relation<T> rRelation)
        Will be invoked if this type has one of the modifiers RelationTypeModifier.FINAL or RelationTypeModifier.READONLY. Can be implemented to prevent external modifications of the relation with this type (e.g. by wrapping a collection in an immutable variant). The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rParent - The parent of the relation
        rRelation - The relation to protect the target of

      • registerRelationListener

        protected void registerRelationListener(Relatable rParent,
                                        EventHandler<RelationEvent<?>> rListener)
        Registers the relation listener that performs the automatic function of this relation type. Depending on the type of the parent object the listener will either be registered as a relation type listener, a relation update listener, or a relation listener for all other relatable objects.
        Parameters:
        rParent - The parent relatable to register the listener on
        rListener - The listener to register

      • removeRelationListener

        protected void removeRelationListener(Relatable rParent,
                                      EventHandler<RelationEvent<?>> rListener)
        Removes a relation listener that had previously been registered with registerRelationListener(Relatable, EventHandler).
        Parameters:
        rParent - The parent relatable to remove the listener from
        rListener - The listener to remove
